content: fellow DMS when I ran curse estrade and
death house I ran most of the upstairs or pretty much all the upstairs of
theater the mind and then when they went to the under underside of the house the
dungeon I ran that pretty much is a dungeon crawl and used a lot of my
terrain and tile escapes and that kind of thing so I thought it'd be fun to
show you those tile scape setups now what you're going to see are my
interpretations of the map I thought it was a lot of pretty big and meandering
and really you didn't really need all those empty rooms and that kind of thing
so I condensed it a bit for my group but I thought it'd be fun to show you guys
my setup so you can see how I set up for the dungeon in the death house now when
they first came down the stairs to the dungeon they come out and they of course
you know all this stuff is not set up on the table right as they come out right
when they come out of the door there I don't set everything up immediately like
I had all the doors set up and everything but the little rooms and
everything I put on after they you know decided to go in that particular room
but what I like to do is like set up the little rooms you know separately and
then with the caskets and everything when they come in just put it on the
table right so very easy but when they come in they start checking the you know
the different rooms the slide where they're going to go and they check the
caskets and there's the course rose and thorns casket there little caskets and
then I had one the cats was broken and there was like a ghoul in there so I
thought that was a kind of a fun encounter then we moved on to the cult
area this was pretty extensive in the module itself but I you know I made it
smaller I mean you really didn't you don't really need all that empty space
right it's just kind of boring stuff so I thought you know a couple rooms with a
couple beds that's really kind of all we needed and then I had the stairs the
secret passage going up there and like I said of course all this isn't
necessarily put down that you know immediately when they come
and you know they come in the door they see the well and the and the archway
going to the other hallway and through the other hallway right the rooms I just
set down with the terrain on them when they when they went into the rooms now
the well because became important later on and I'll explain why when they have
the encounter so as they move on they encounter you know the whole thing with
them the whole thing was it was cool with the house was it was kind of
cannibal thing right the parents were these depraved cannibals and debt house
hungers for life from that right so I had I had a room where they had stashed
all the the skeletons from the feast they had you know which is pretty grisly
and they were attacked by so I had them attack by some skeletons that were being
controlled by the former inhabitants the Durst parents and I had them turned into
kind of like bloated ghoul like things and they were controlling the skeleton
to try to drag them into the the din of the dinner hall that feast on them but
they got past that and I got in the they got in the dinner hall my had the doors
behind these curtains as you can see on the tile and I had the hall all set up
and everything and so they couldn't immediately see them and they come in
and the dirt I had them slow because they're kind of bloated and they're
saying they're so hungry and all their curses to be like eternally hungry right
and so they're they're starving and they're they're dragging their bulks you
know after the players and I had this thing where they could like vomit you
know on the players really gross spit this you know acidic bile and vomit on
them and when I had them when they killed them they kind of explode and
this this bile which was just disgusting so that's where the well came in when
after they had this encounter that's where the world came in now the fight
this was the big encounter of the dungeon now in the module it's kind of
like this I think it's to logger off something like that this creature that's
in the final room but if you do this if you play your cards right you won't have
to fight that thing so I wanted to have a nice set-piece encounter that
creepy and thematic for the house but you know it wasn't easy for them to
avoid as the you know the whole long ross saying you know that if they
sacrifice to the house they don't have to you know i didn't have long ross
summoned if they sacrifice to the house so as they move on they discover a
couple more rooms one is like an old storage room okay and then the module
they had a creek which I didn't think was very thematic but I put a bunch of
rats in there and they didn't really tangle with them but they figured out
that they could when they have to sacrifice life to the house they could
sacrifice some rats and that's what they did then I had another room where it had
a statue of straud which is tying straw into this you know they had found a
letter from straw Tupper in the upper level of the house kind of tied straw
into it they didn't mess with the the black orb that he's holding so they you
know they didn't have that problem they thought maybe they had to sacrifice rats
to swrod because they found these chairs that had spikes in them and they people
would sit you know and then they'd bleed people dry or whatever and these chairs
and so they thought maybe they had to do that with the rats and that really
wasn't the case it was just a torture room that they had so but they did
figure out that they had to take the rats down and sacrifice them to the
house they had sacrificed a life to get out of the house so now let's go to the
final level and I change it up quite a bit from what's in the module so I
wanted the room to be pretty interesting if they fought the creature at the end
you know and kind of the strategy is for this thing you want to kind of drag it
you know kind of kite the thing you know right so I gave them lots of places they
could go you know get around and perch on and stuff in the monster to have to
kind of chase them around so but like I said my group ended up kind of
circumventing that because they sacrifice the rat so I didn't have that
but the room I thought was really cool I did you know the the cellophane kind of
for the water to make it look I panned the board underneath and the cellophane
for the water to make it kind of look like water and I had these blocks for
the elevated parts of the room out of the water so
so pretty neat but like I say you know they figured it out so kudos to them and
I hope you guys like this tour of the death house basement that I modified
with my towels gates and see you guys next time hey friends I thought you
might like to see more graphs of the care which is the final boss monster if
the players don't sacrifice to the house which mine did so I never pulled it out
but here's the mini if you want to see what I was going to use it's actually a
shambling Mountain mini that I printed off the internet and printed on my 3d
printer and there you go I added a little detail to it with some modeling
paste and there's my to care but he never came out so I'll have to use them
for something else
